private_information: I am the left peg and initially hold six disks in this order from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F. A is the smallest, F is the largest.
left_agent.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg in the same top-to-bottom order A, B, C, D, E, F.

private_information: I am the middle peg and initially hold no disks.
middle_agent.goal: Be used as an intermediary peg as needed so that all disks end on the right peg in order A, B, C, D, E, F.

private_information: I am the right peg and initially hold no disks.
right_agent.goal: Receive all disks so that my final stack from top to bottom is A, B, C, D, E, F.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that solves the 6-disk Tower of Hanoi from the given initial state to the goal state, suitable for the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are six disks labeled A (smallest) through F (largest).
Legal moves: move one disk at a time from the top of one peg to the top of another peg.
Constraint: never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top to bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg empty; middle peg empty; right peg has (top to bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F.

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent that represents the left peg in a Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Describe your local initial stack, your capabilities for passing information about valid top-disk moves, and any local constraints you observe. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise, precise description of your state and the moves you can observe or perform.
describe.prompt: Your name is left_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->left_agent->private_information}. Your local goal: {agents->left_agent->goal}. Provide a concise description of your initial stack and the local move constraints you see and any assumptions you make about how disks are named or referenced. Do not output PDDL.

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent that represents the middle peg in a Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Describe your local initial stack (which may be empty), how you can be used as an intermediary, and any constraints you observe. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise, precise description of your state and local move possibilities.
describe.prompt: Your name is middle_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->middle_agent->private_information}. Your local goal: {agents->middle_agent->goal}. Provide a concise description of your initial stack and how you can be used as an intermediary for legal moves. Do not output PDDL.

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent that represents the right peg in a Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Describe your local initial stack (which may be empty), the expected final stack, and any constraints you observe. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise, precise description of your state and local move possibilities.
describe.prompt: Your name is right_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->right_agent->private_information}. Your local goal: {agents->right_agent->goal}. Provide a concise description of your initial stack and the final desired stack, and describe move constraints relevant to your peg. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL, tasked with producing a complete PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the local descriptions from the peg agents, resolve naming or representation differences, and produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that models the Tower of Hanoi constraints and initial/goal configurations for six disks and three pegs. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Ensure the domain uses classical PDDL constructs supported by FastDownwards (STRIPS-style actions), models moving only top disks, and enforces the rule that larger disks cannot be placed on smaller ones. Keep agent roles distinct if you model per-peg actions, and ensure the produced PDDL is syntactically correct.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You received the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You also received these local descriptions from the agents: desc_left: {desc_left} desc_middle: {desc_middle} desc_right: {desc_right}. Your job is to integrate these descriptions and output a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem pair that solves the task: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Target the PDDL to be compatible with the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Be explicit about predicates, types, objects, initial state, and goal state. Ensure moves are atomic actions that move the top disk from one peg to another and that larger-on-smaller placements are disallowed by preconditions.
